success.description: 0: success, 1: error server, 2: game full, 3: Already applied, 4: already playing

Creates a team. TeamSize should be either 6 or 11.

post.summary: Get the teams you BELONG to, but do not own.
post.description: Get the teams you BELONG to, but do not own.
creates a duty. you pass in the name of the duty, and the team you want it assigned to. you must be the team manager to use this request.

success.description: 0: success, 1: server error, 2: authentication error (need to be the manager)

post.summary: Assigns users to a given duty.
post.description: You pass in a duty ID, and a list of user IDs. This will assign those users to the duty. You need to be the team manager to do this.

success.description: 0: success, 1: server error, 2: authentication error (need to be the manager)

post.summary: Removes a team member from a duty.
post.description: Pass in a duty ID and a user ID, and it takes the user off the list of people assigned to that duty. Does NOT remove the duty - only the link between user and duty. Need to be the team manager to do this.

success.description: 0: success, 1: server error, 2: authentication error (need to be the manager)

post.summary: Gets a list of team duties.
post.description: Pass in team ID, gets a list of team duties. You need to be in the team to do this. Keys in the JSON object 'Duties' will be the Duty IDs. The objects assigned to these keys will be the duty data.

success.description: 0: success, 1: server error, 2: authentication error (need to be the manager)

post.description: Given a DutyID, will remove a duty from a team, and any user assignments. You need to be the team manager to do this.

success.description: 0: success, 1: server error, 2: authentication error (need to be the manager)

post.summary: Get a list of recent articles
post.description: Gets a list of recent article IDs, capped by a millisecond timestamp cutoff of your choice. Article data can be retrieved using /get-article.

post.summary: Returns a list of all vendors and their details.
post.description: Vendors aren't too heavy weight of a request, so multiple requests for all the vendors would be a little pointless. All the vendor info is returns in this request.
Returns more details about a vendor, given a vendor ID.

post.summary: Gets a list of articles by a given vendor
post.description: This returns article IDs, no other data.
Gets more specific info about an article from an ID. IDs are obtained from other methods, like get recent articles.
